author: peter.davies
content:
The entropy of the random setup is 32 bytes. There are `2**32` possible random setups, one for each value of `s`. Every element of the setup is determined by `s`.

The way the random setup is performed means that each participant adds the full 32 bytes of entropy. This gives us a 1 of N security property. If even one person participates honestly the remaining `N-1` know absolutely nothing about `s` that they aren't supposed to even if they collude.
